contentrichtext.text: '''Lys''' may refer to any of the following: ;Places *The Lys or [[Leie]], a river in France and Belgium *[[Lys (Dora Baltea)]], a stream of Aosta Valley in Italy *[[Lys, Pyrénées-Atlantiques]], a commune in the Pyrénées-Atlantiques department in France *[[Lys (département)]], a ''département'' during the First French Empire, now in Belgium *[[Les Lys]], a Premier cru vineyard in [[Chablis (wine)|Chablis]] *Lys, an old orthography of [[Liss]], Hampshire, England *LYS can also refer to a Local Yarn Shop for knitters or crocheters ;Aviation *''LYS'', the IATA Airport Code for [[Lyon-Saint Exupéry Airport]] ;Sailing *[[LYS (sailing)|LYS]], a sailing handicapping system ;Battles *[[Battle of the Lys (1918)|Battle of the Lys]], a World War I battle in the spring of 1918 ;Fiction * Lys is the name of a city in Arthur C. Clarke's book [[The City and the Stars]]. * Lys is also the name of a city in George R. R. Martin's epic series [[A Song of Ice and Fire]]. ;Heraldry *Fleur-de-lys or [[Fleur-de-lis]], a stylized representation of a lily or iris, used in heraldry ;Science *''Lys'' is an abbreviation for the amino acid [[lysine]] ;People *[[Francis John Lys]] (1863–1947), British lecturer and academic administrator *[[Jan Lys]] (c1590-1629), a German painter *[[Lya Lys]] (1908–1986), German-born actress *[[Lys Assia]] (born 1926, Rupperswil), Swiss singer *[[Lys Mouithys]] (born 1985), Congolese football player ;Other *{{Ill|nl|La Lys (factory)|La Lys}}, in [[Ghent]], Belgium {{disambig}}
